citations.narrative:
The facility has not maintained documentation for the annual review of their contingency plan. During the record review
portion of the inspection, the inspector asked when the plan’s annual review took place; where the facility documents their
annual reviews; and if any amendments to the contingency plan have occurred. The facility representative stated no
amendments have been made to the contingency plan, and the reviews occur on a routine basis at the facility. When
asked to view the documentation for the annual review, the facility representative stated the review of the contingency
plan takes place when the animal inventory records are updated. Although this practice is in place at the facility, the
annual reviews were not documented.
Reviewing the outlined plan in place ensures the facility has assessed the current plan for any needed amendments to
better prepare for unexpected disasters or events, as well as a detailed strategy to address instructions for, but not limited
to: animal evacuation, sheltering-in-place, and backup provisions for husbandry and food/watering supplies, sanitation,
and ventilation. The facility shall develop and document an appropriate contingency, with the plan and all annual review
documentation made available to APHIS upon request.
Correct by February 2, 2024.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representatives.
Additional Inspectors:
CHRISTINA RADZAI, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n
